name: Recurse Center
headline: The retreat where curious programmers recharge and grow
description:
The Recurse Center is a self-directed, educational retreat for people who want to get better at programming, whether they've been programming for three decades or three months.

The retreat is free for all participants because we run an integrated recruiting agency and provide (optional) personalized recruiting services to anyone in our community considering a new job.

# Build your projects, network, and career.
Invest six or 12 weeks programming at the edge of your abilities alongside motivated peers. Do a programming retreat in NYC, hybrid, or remotely.
### Work hard on _your_ projects.
Remind yourself why programming rocks with code that sparks your joy and curiosity. You pick the projects you work on, with no deadlines, grades, or OKRs.
### Gain the support and insight of 2,600+ people. Go further together.
You’ll get to work with and learn from kind and curious programmers of all skill levels. Whether you’re an EM ready to code again, a self-taught hobbyist, a staff engineer, a recent grad, or a former founder, there’s a place for you at RC.
### Get connected to great companies.
Our optional recruiting services keep RC 100% free for everyone. If you want a new job, we can connect you with new opportunities.
[Learn more](https://www.recurse.com/</about>)
![](https://d29xw0ra2h4o4u.cloudfront.net/assets/home_slideshow_07-8ffccf8ae69f3a38f2d3be7f8ce79936b46ffad75b31b9383c4a8d4f12d3a075.jpg)
![](https://d29xw0ra2h4o4u.cloudfront.net/assets/landing/helen_ngo-2781142a233d2521741efda21f52295de94c2980648d42ea343788d5c7609635.jpg)
> The Recurse Center gave me time, space, light and clarity I never knew was possible. Being here has been transformational as a programmer and a human being. I'm in awe that this place exists and it's ours.
> [– Helen Ngo, ML Engineer and Researcher](https://www.recurse.com/<https:/twitter.com/mathemakitten/status/1193716355633229825>)
![](https://d29xw0ra2h4o4u.cloudfront.net/assets/landing/jonathan_strickland-3fc20413db0fa4514943b4d0a939ca1b15ceb786c37132d685b1bb9b40af6ac6.jpg)
> Attending the Recurse Center has been life-changing for me. Never before in my life have I had this experience of being surrounded by kind people, supporting each other and cooperating, focused on improvement and learning, avoiding competition. The lack of curriculum really hits!
> [– Jonathan Strickland, Senior Backend Engineer](https://www.recurse.com/<https:/twitter.com/djanatyn/status/1528741648510894080>)
![](https://d29xw0ra2h4o4u.cloudfront.net/assets/landing/andrew_kelley-aeb9e36ddefe94bd0f9992a4b78e53730151f7c08dae56522a21a5c039d89b1f.jpg)
> The Recurse Center is one of those rare things where you find a small group of dedicated people who believe in a cause and pour their heart and soul into it, and it shows. I would recommend this to anybody who wants to invest time in becoming a dramatically better programmer.
> [– Andrew Kelley, creator of Zig](https://www.recurse.com/<https:/twitter.com/andy_kelley/status/1214966010471731200>)
![](https://d29xw0ra2h4o4u.cloudfront.net/assets/landing/serena_peruzzo-2b9aa1778f6f10c64ee254ac64a9d7198283c4e62de0bf048dd694757a8a3677.jpg)
> RC is a magical place where you go to become a better programmer. The diversity and a super welcoming environment have made RC one of the best educational experiences I’ve ever had!
> [– Serena Peruzzo, Senior Data Scientist](https://www.recurse.com/<https:/words.serenaperuzzo.com/posts/return-statement/>)
### Gain focus and accountability
With all the resources and distractions of the internet, it can be hard to know what to work on first—or even work up the motivation to start.
RC gives you a clear beginning, end, purpose, and name for your time off—and friendly social accountability to keep you going. With our supportive facilitators, you’ll get better at directing your time, picking your projects, and meeting the goals you set for yourself.
You'll also get 24/7 access to our Brooklyn hub—perfect for quiet work or on-demand serendipity.
During your retreat, you’ll learn how to optimize your time and abilities—and do more than you thought was possible.
[ Plan your retreat ](https://www.recurse.com/</about>)
### Discover what's next
RC is an ideal way to spend time between jobs: it gives you time and space to clear your head, grow as a programmer, and think intentionally about what you want out of your next job and beyond.
At RC, you’ll receive lifelong career support with a team of recruiters who know and care about you. Our Career Services team provides personalized job recommendations and referrals for companies that align with your values and goals (from a human, not an algorithm). Plus, you'll be matched with friendly alumni mock interviewers who have been in your shoes and gone on to work at successful companies.
[ Invest in your career ](https://www.recurse.com/</career-services>)
### Find your people
It’s hard to focus on programming when you don’t feel like you belong.
For over a decade, we’ve worked to build an environment that is not just productive and educational, but also supportive, friendly, and positive. We provided over $1.7 million in living expense grants for underrepresented groups in tech and lightweight social rules to foster collaborative growth.
Come to RC and learn generously – no matter your background.
[ Learn about our approach ](https://www.recurse.com/</self-directives>)

**Recurse Center: A Haven for Curious Programmers**

Founded in 2010 and part of Y Combinator’s Batch S10, the Recurse Center (RC) is a unique educational retreat in New York City designed specifically for programmers seeking to hone their skills. Whether you're a seasoned coder or just starting out, RC invites you to recharge, grow, and work on projects that ignite your curiosity. 

### The Concept
At its core, Recurse Center operates on a simple but powerful premise: learning is personal and self-directed. The retreat spans six to twelve weeks, during which participants immerse themselves in coding—without the pressures of deadlines, grades, or performance metrics (think of it as a coding sabbatical). With a friendly environment and no formal curriculum, it allows developers from various backgrounds to collaborate, share insights, and support one another.

### Cost and Support
Remarkably, RC is free for all participants. This is possible because they run an integrated recruiting agency that offers optional personalized job placement services. This approach not only removes financial barriers but also fosters a community of cooperation rather than competition.

### Community and Connection
Currently, the Recurse Center has a dedicated team of about ten employees and a vast network of over 2,600 alumni—each adding to the rich tapestry of support and collaboration. Participants benefit from 24/7 access to RC's Brooklyn hub, enabling them to work in a quiet and inspiring space or connect with peers from around the world.

### Career Perks
The Recurse Center is also a strategic stepping stone for those seeking new opportunities post-retreat. The Career Services team takes a personal approach, matching participants with companies and roles that align with their goals and values. Additionally, friendly alumni are on hand to provide mock interview practice, enhancing the chances of landing a job that fits.

### A Commitment to Diversity
RC is especially committed to inclusivity and has invested over $1.7 million in living expense grants to underrepresented groups in tech. They have worked hard to create a welcoming atmosphere where everyone can thrive, regardless of their background.

### In Their Words
Participants have echoed their experiences, calling RC a "magical place" and a "transformational" retreat for both personal and professional development. As Andrew Kelley, creator of Zig, stated: “It’s rare to find such dedicated people who genuinely believe in a cause.”

### Explore More
If you're curious to learn more about the Recurse Center or considering applying, you can visit their website at [Recurse Center](https://www.recurse.com). There, you’ll find a wealth of resources about their approach, the application process, and insights from current and former participants.

In a world where coding often becomes a solitary endeavor, the Recurse Center stands out as a collaborative sanctuary. If you're looking to get better at programming while being supported by a community of like-minded individuals, this could be the retreat for you.
